topic.title: Using the tool
topic.shortdesc: Commands used by the Backup and Restore tool are create, cluster, restore, merge, compact, and remove.

dlentry.dt: Create an archive repository with the command create:
dlentry.dd: If the archive repository doesn't exist, the tool will attempt to create it: ./backup create --dir [directory-name] --name [repository-name] --host [hostname] \ --username [admin] --password [password]

dlentry.dt: Back up data with the command cluster:
Merge backups wit the command merge
dlentry.dd:
Merging incremental backups allows you to free up disk space on the machine where your backup archive server is located by de-duplicating similar data between backups. It also enables you to run continuous incremental backups instead of full backups and to reduce significantly the amount of time you spend backing up your cluster. To merge backups, you just need to specify the starting and ending backups that you would like to merge.
The merge command copies the oldest backup to be merged to a separate .merge directory. Data from each subsequent incremental backup directory, which is a part of the merge, is then copied to this directory. Once all of the data has been merged in the .merge directory, the old backups are deleted from the backup archive and the .merge directory is renamed to the backup specified in the --end argument.
Merging of backups is fault-tolerant, and data loss is not possible even if the backup tool crashes: there is a .merge_status file that records the last completed step of the process and which incremental backups are supposed to be merged. If a merge fails to complete, the backup tool will detect an incomplete merge and revert it.
To merge several backups together: ./backup merge --dir [directory-name] --name [repository-name] --start 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00 \ --end 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00The merge command does not delete any files from the backup archive until it is finished merging all of the data together. Make sure there is a free disk space at least equal to the size of all incremental backups that are being merged.

dlentry.dt: Restore data with the command restore
dlentry.dd:
Only full Couchbase administrators can perform restores using their credentials.
First decide which backups you want to restore. Use the --start and --end flags to specify the backups. If the --start flag is not specified, it defaults to the first backup taken. If the --end flag is not specified, it defaults to the last flag taken. If you want to start or end from a different backup, specify the name of the backup for one or both of these flags.
If you want to start or end from a different backup, specify the name of the backup for one or both of these flags. To restore all backups in the backup repository travel:
$> ./backup restore --dir [directory-name] --name travel --host [hostname] \ --username [admin] --password [password]

dlentry.dt: Compact data with the command compact
dlentry.dd: Compact the data of an incremental backup and after the backup has completed: ./backup compact --dir [directory-name] --name [repository-name] --incr-backup 2016-01-22T15:42:41.383468246-08:00

dlentry.dt: Remove a backup from the backup archive with the command remove
dlentry.dd: Remove a backup from the backup archive. Make sure the data is no longer needed! ./backup remove --dir [directory-name] --name [repository-name]

dlentry.dt: List the contents of a backup, Backup Repository or entire Backup Archive with the command list
dlentry.dd: Llist the backup from the backup archive for a specific backup respository. ./backup list --dir [directory-name] --name [repository-name]
